_exec_summary.SummaryText:
DESCRIPTION OF THE STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES



Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC, located in Aurora, Nebraska, U.S.A., operates processes to produce ethyl alcohol which is denatured with natural gasoline.  Natural gasoline contains regulated substances isopentane and pentane.  Denatured ethyl alcohol is stored on site, and then shipped to customers.



GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM 

 

The following is a summary of the accidental release prevention program in place at Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC.  Because a process at the facility that is regulated by the Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA's) risk management program (RMP) regulation is also subject to the Occupational Safety and Health Administration's (OSHA's) process safety management (PSM) standard, this summary addresses each of the OSHA PSM elements and describes the management system in place to implement the accidental release prevention program.

 

EMPLOYEE PARTICIPATION

 

Involvement and participation by all employees and their representatives is an important aspect of Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC PSM / RMP program.  Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC employee involvement in the PSM / RMP programs will ensure that all perspectives are considered and that the best ideas are implemented. In addition, all Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC employees have the right, and the responsibility, to participate in the development of PSM activities.



PROCESS SAFETY INFORMATION

 

Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC has compiled written process safety information for all PSM covered processes.  The process safety information includes the hazards of chemicals used or produced in the process, process technology information, and process equipment data.  The process safety information is updated whenever process changes are made.



Accurate and complete process safety information enables Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC employees involved in operating and maintaining the plant

to identify and understand the hazards of the process.  Process safety information is used to conduct process hazard analysis on the existing process or a proposed modification to a process.



Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC process safety information is maintained and is available to all affected employees. 

 

PROCESS HAZARD ANALYSIS (PHA)

 

Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC is committed to performing a detailed hazard analysis of each covered process to identify, evaluate, and control hazards involved in the processes.  Each process is systematically examined to identify potential hazards controls in place to manage these hazards, and recommend additional controls, as appropriate.

 

Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC uses the hazard and operability (HAZOP) and check list PHA methodologies, which are conducted using a team of people who have operating and maintenance experience as well as engineering expertise.  The team identifies and evaluates potential hazards of the process as well as accident prevention and mitigation measures, and makes suggestions for additional prevention and / or mitigation measures. 

 

Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC periodically updates and re-validates the hazard analysis results.  As a minimum these periodic reviews are conducted every 5 years as long as the process is operating.



PHA finding and recommendations and the resolution of thereof are documented.  Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC has implemented a system to address and resolve all PHA findings and recommendations in a timely manner through a written schedule.  All PHA findings and recommendation resolutions are communicated to all effected employees.  All recommendations must be resolved by management.



OPERATING PROCEDURES

 

The policy of Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC is to ensure that all operations covered under PSM have detailed procedures to cover each step of the process to assure that a ready and up to date reference is available and to form a foundat

ion for needed employee training.  Operating procedures are readily accessible to employees who work in or maintain a process.



Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC operating procedures are reviewed as often as necessary to ensure that they reflect current operating practices, including changes in process chemicals, technology, equipment and facilities. To guard against outdated or inaccurate operating procedures, Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC certifies and documents annually that these operating procedures are current and accurate.



Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC written procedures address the following phases of operation including: a) initial startup procedures; b) normal operating procedures; c) temporary operations; d) emergency shutdown procedures; e) emergency operations; f) normal shutdown; g) startup after a turnaround or emergency shutdown; h) operating limits; i) safety and health considerations; and j) safety systems.

 

TRAINING

 

Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC believes that the implementation of an effective training program is one of the most important steps that an employer can take to enhance employee safety. Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC requires that each employee presently involved in operating a process or a newly assigned process must be trained in an overview of the process and in its operating procedures.  This training is done on initial hiring, when there are any changes in Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC operations and at least every three (3) years.  Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC training includes emphasis on the specific safety and health hazards of the process, emergency operations including shutdown, and other safe work practices that apply to the employee's job tasks.



Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC periodically evaluates training programs to see if the necessary skills, knowledge, and routines are being properly understood and implemented by their trained employees.

 

CONTRACTORS

 

Pacific Ethanol Aurora East

, LLC uses contractors to supplement its workforce during periods of additional maintenance or construction activities.  Because some contractors work on or near PSM covered process equipment, the facility has procedures in place to ensure that contractors are qualified to perform the work and are informed of the potential hazards.



Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC provides contractors with a site specific orientation that includes; a process overview, information about safety and health hazards, emergency response plan requirements, and safe work practices prior to their beginning work.



Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC evaluates contractor safety programs and performance during the selection of a contractor and throughout the contractors work activities.  Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC Facility personnel periodically monitor contractor performance with regard to their safety obligations.



PRE-STARTUP SAFETY REVIEWS (PSSR's)

 

Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC requires a pre-startup safety review (PSSR) to be performed and documented for any physical modification in the PSM covered processes.  Additionally, any new units added at Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC which is considered PSM covered processes will also require a PSSR to be performed and documented.



MECHANICAL INTEGRITY

 

Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC believes it is important to maintain the mechanical integrity of critical process equipment to ensure it is designed and installed correctly and operates properly. Inspections and testing are performed on process equipment, using procedures that follow the manufacturer?s recommendations, and recognized and generally accepted good engineering practices.  Each inspection and test on process equipment is documented, identifying the date, the name of the person who performed the inspection or test, the serial number or other identifier of the equipment, a description of the inspection or test performed, and the results.



Pacific Ethanol Aurora

East, LLC ensures that equipment deficiencies outside of the acceptable limits are corrected before further use or in a safe and timely manner when necessary means are taken to provide safe operation.  Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC will ensure that new or modified plants and equipment are fabricated, and installed properly and consistent with design specifications.  Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC will ensure that maintenance materials, spare parts, and equipment are suitable for the application for which they will be used.

 

SAFE WORK PRACTICES

 

Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC has developed and implemented safe work practices to provide for the control of hazards during work activities such as lockout/tagout; confined space entry; opening process equipment or piping; and control over entrance into a facility by maintenance, contractor, laboratory, or other support personnel. These safe work practices apply both to employees and to contractor employees.

 

MANAGEMENT OF CHANGE

 

Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC requires that a Management of Change (MOC) be performed for any modification to equipment, procedures, raw materials, and process conditions of a PSM covered process.



The Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC Management of Change program ensures that modifications to the process are reviewed before installation to ensure that no unforeseen hazards are introduced.  The modification is also reviewed after installation, but before startup, to ensure that the installation met all safety and design requirements.  The MOC process also requires that equipment records, process safety information, operator training, and operating procedures are updated when changes in the process occur.



ACCIDENT HISTORY



Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC has not experienced an accident involving RMP regulated substances within the last 5-years. 



INCIDENT INVESTIGATION

 

Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC requires any incidents that resulted in a release of a highly

hazardous chemical, or near misses, must be investigated.  The incident investigation will be started as soon as possible, but no later than 48 hours following the incident.  A team consisting of at least one person knowledgeable in the process will investigate the incident. The Process Incident Investigation Teams gather, examine, and report the facts pertaining to each process incident.  Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC has established a system to promptly address and resolve the reported incident investigation findings and recommendations.  Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC then implements appropriate preventative measures to reduce the potential for future recurrence of similar process incidents.  All affected Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC personnel and contractors review the completed incident investigation reports.



COMPLIANCE AUDITS

 

Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC will certify compliance with the provisions of PSM and RMP at least every three (3) years through the completion of compliance audits.  The compliance audits will verify that the procedures and practices developed under the standard are adequate and are being implemented.  Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC compliance audits are conducted by at least one person knowledgeable in the process.  A report of the findings of the audit and recommendations are developed and documented noting findings and recommendations that require resolution.



 The two most recent compliance audit reports are maintained in the PSM filing system.  

 

EMERGENCY ACTION PLAN INFORMATION

 

Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC maintains a written emergency action plan, which is in place to help protect worker and public safety as well as the environment.  The program consists of procedures for responding to a release of a regulated substance, including the possibility of a fire or explosion if a flammable substance is accidentally released.  The procedures address all aspects of emergency actions, including proper firs

t aid and medical treatment for exposures, evacuation plans and accounting for personnel after an evacuation, notification of local emergency response agencies and the public, if a release occurs, and post incident cleanup and decontamination requirements.  In addition, Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC has procedures that address maintenance, inspection, and testing of its emergency action plan.  Employees receive training in these procedures as necessary to perform their specific emergency response duties.  When necessary, the emergency action plan is updated based on modifications made to Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC processes.  The emergency action plan changes are administered through the MOC process, which includes informing and/or training affected personnel in the changes.

 

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

 

Pacific Ethanol Aurora East, LLC resolves all findings and recommendations from PHA's and compliance audits, some of which result in modifications to the process.
